intro: Polyscias waimeae, commonly known as the Waimea glorybower, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palm-like leaves that are typically large and lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
